alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN RUTLAND COUNTY... At 455 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Danby, or 13 miles north of Manchester, moving east at 20 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail are possible with this storm. Locations impacted include... Danby, Lake St. Catherine, Pawlet, Mount Tabor, Tinmouth, Middletown Springs, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Wells, Mount Holly, Weston, Poultney, East Wallingford, North Pawlet, Belmont, East Wells, Russellville, Danby Four Corners and South Wallingford. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm, and may cause localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
